files.name: README.md
files.body:
# GnoBounty

A decentralized bounty system for managing rewards on GitHub issues (or any issue tracker) using the Gno blockchain, with DAO-based validation through validator voting.

## Features

- **Create Bounties**: Post a bounty on any issue by providing the issue URL and sending GNOT tokens
- **Apply for Bounties**: Submit your merged PR link to apply for a bounty
- **DAO Validation**: 3 validators are randomly selected to vote on each application
- **Automatic Claims**: Bounties are automatically claimed when 2/3 validators approve
- **Validator System**: Decentralized validation through registered validators
- **Cancel Bounties**: Creators can cancel unclaimed bounties and receive a refund
- **List Bounties**: Browse all active bounties with reward amounts
- **Transparent**: All bounties and applications are stored on-chain and publicly viewable

## How to Use

### Creating a Bounty

To create a bounty, call the `CreateBounty` function with the issue URL and description, and send GNOT tokens:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "CreateBounty" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/1234" \
  -args "Fix the rendering bug in GRC20 token display" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- `issueURL`: The URL of the issue (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
- `description`: A brief description of what needs to be done
- `send`: The bounty amount in ugnot (1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot)

**Minimum bounty**: 1 GNOT (1,000,000 ugnot)

### Viewing Bounties

Visit the realm in your browser to see all active bounties:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty
```

Or view a specific bounty by ID:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty/1
```

### Applying for a Bounty

When you complete work on a bounty, submit your merged PR link to apply:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "ApplyForBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/5678" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Bounty ID
- Second arg: URL of your merged pull request

**What happens next:**
1. Your application is created
2. 3 random validators are selected from the validator pool
3. Validators review your PR and vote to approve or reject
4. If 2 out of 3 validators approve, the bounty is automatically transferred to you!

### Validator Voting

If you're a registered validator, you can vote on applications assigned to you:

```bash
# Approve an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey

# Reject an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "false" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Application ID
- Second arg: "true" to approve, "false" to reject

### Legacy: Manual Claiming (deprecated)

The old manual claim system is still available but deprecated in favor of DAO validation:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "ClaimBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "g1abc123...xyz" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

### Cancelling a Bounty

If you need to cancel a bounty and get your funds back:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "CancelBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Note:** You can only cancel bounties that haven't been claimed yet.

## API Reference

### Bounty Functions

#### `CreateBounty(cur realm, issueURL, description string) uint64`
Creates a new bounty and returns the bounty ID. Must send GNOT with the transaction.

#### `GetBounty(id uint64) *Bounty`
Returns bounty details by ID.

#### `CancelBounty(cur realm, id uint64)`
Cancels a bounty and refunds the creator. Only callable by the bounty creator on unclaimed bounties.

#### `ListBounties() string`
Returns a formatted list of all active bounties.

#### `GetBountyDetails(id uint64) string`
Returns detailed information about a specific bounty with apply button.

#### `GetBountyCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of bounties created.

### Application & Voting Functions

#### `ApplyForBounty(cur realm, bountyID uint64, prLink string) uint64`
Submit an application for a bounty with your merged PR link. Returns the application ID.
- Automatically selects 3 random validators
- Creates a pending application
- Returns application ID

#### `Vote(cur realm, applicationID uint64, approve bool)`
Vote on an application (validator only). Must be one of the selected validators.
- `approve`: true to approve, false to reject
- Automatically claims bounty if 2/3 validators approve

#### `GetApplication(id uint64) *Application`
Returns application details by ID.

#### `GetApplicationsForBounty(bountyID uint64) []*Application`
Returns all applications for a specific bounty.

#### `GetApplicationsForValidator(validatorAddr address) []*Application`
Returns all applications assigned to a validator for voting.

#### `GetApplicationCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of applications created.

### Validator Management Functions

#### `AddValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Adds a new validator to the system (admin function).

#### `RemoveValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Deactivates a validator (admin function).

#### `IsValidator(addr address) bool`
Checks if an address is an active validator.

#### `GetActiveValidatorCount() int`
Returns the number of active validators.

#### `ListValidators() string`
Returns a formatted list of all validators and their status.

### Rendering Functions

#### `RenderMyVotes(validatorAddr address) string`
Shows pending applications that need votes from the specified validator, with approve/reject buttons.

#### `Render(path string) string`
Main render function for the realm.

### Bounty Structure

```go
type Bounty struct {
    ID          uint64    // Unique bounty identifier
    IssueURL    string    // Link to the issue
    Description string    // Description of the work
    Amount      int64     // Reward amount in ugnot
    Creator     address   // Address of the bounty creator
    CreatedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was created
    IsClaimed   bool      // Whether the bounty has been claimed
    Claimer     address   // Address of the claimer (if claimed)
    ClaimedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was claimed
}
```

## Example Workflow

1. **Alice creates a bounty** for fixing a bug, sending 5 GNOT:
   ```
   CreateBounty("https://github.com/project/repo/issues/42", "Fix memory leak in parser")
   ```

2. **Bob sees the bounty** and decides to work on it. He visits the issue URL and starts coding.

3. **Bob completes the work** and submits a pull request fixing the issue.

4. **Alice verifies the fix** and approves Bob's claim:
   ```
   ClaimBounty(cross, 1, "g1bob123...xyz")
   ```

5. **Bob receives 5 GNOT** automatically to his address!

## Security Considerations

- Only the bounty creator can approve claims
- Bounties are locked in the realm contract until claimed or cancelled
- Once claimed, bounties cannot be cancelled
- The realm must have sufficient funds to pay out bounties

## Notes

- This implementation uses the new Gno standard library split (post-#3874)
- Amounts are stored in ugnot (micro-GNOT): 1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot
- The `address` type is used as a builtin instead of `std.Address`
- Uses new imports:
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain` for `Coin` and `Coins` types
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/banker` for banker operations (`NewBanker`, `BankerType*`, `OriginSend`)
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/runtime` for realm functions (`PreviousRealm`, `CurrentRealm`)

## License

MIT

files.name: nft.gno
README.md
files.body:
# GnoBounty

A decentralized bounty system for managing rewards on GitHub issues (or any issue tracker) using the Gno blockchain, with DAO-based validation through validator voting.

## Features

- **Create Bounties**: Post a bounty on any issue by providing the issue URL and sending GNOT tokens
- **Apply for Bounties**: Submit your merged PR link to apply for a bounty
- **DAO Validation**: 3 validators are randomly selected to vote on each application
- **Automatic Claims**: Bounties are automatically claimed when 2/3 validators approve
- **Validator System**: Decentralized validation through registered validators
- **Cancel Bounties**: Creators can cancel unclaimed bounties and receive a refund
- **List Bounties**: Browse all active bounties with reward amounts
- **Transparent**: All bounties and applications are stored on-chain and publicly viewable

## How to Use

### Creating a Bounty

To create a bounty, call the `CreateBounty` function with the issue URL and description, and send GNOT tokens:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "CreateBounty" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/1234" \
  -args "Fix the rendering bug in GRC20 token display" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- `issueURL`: The URL of the issue (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
- `description`: A brief description of what needs to be done
- `send`: The bounty amount in ugnot (1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot)

**Minimum bounty**: 1 GNOT (1,000,000 ugnot)

### Viewing Bounties

Visit the realm in your browser to see all active bounties:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty
```

Or view a specific bounty by ID:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty/1
```

### Applying for a Bounty

When you complete work on a bounty, submit your merged PR link to apply:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "ApplyForBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/5678" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Bounty ID
- Second arg: URL of your merged pull request

**What happens next:**
1. Your application is created
2. 3 random validators are selected from the validator pool
3. Validators review your PR and vote to approve or reject
4. If 2 out of 3 validators approve, the bounty is automatically transferred to you!

### Validator Voting

If you're a registered validator, you can vote on applications assigned to you:

```bash
# Approve an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey

# Reject an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "false" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Application ID
- Second arg: "true" to approve, "false" to reject

### Legacy: Manual Claiming (deprecated)

The old manual claim system is still available but deprecated in favor of DAO validation:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "ClaimBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "g1abc123...xyz" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

### Cancelling a Bounty

If you need to cancel a bounty and get your funds back:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty" \
  -func "CancelBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Note:** You can only cancel bounties that haven't been claimed yet.

## API Reference

### Bounty Functions

#### `CreateBounty(cur realm, issueURL, description string) uint64`
Creates a new bounty and returns the bounty ID. Must send GNOT with the transaction.

#### `GetBounty(id uint64) *Bounty`
Returns bounty details by ID.

#### `CancelBounty(cur realm, id uint64)`
Cancels a bounty and refunds the creator. Only callable by the bounty creator on unclaimed bounties.

#### `ListBounties() string`
Returns a formatted list of all active bounties.

#### `GetBountyDetails(id uint64) string`
Returns detailed information about a specific bounty with apply button.

#### `GetBountyCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of bounties created.

### Application & Voting Functions

#### `ApplyForBounty(cur realm, bountyID uint64, prLink string) uint64`
Submit an application for a bounty with your merged PR link. Returns the application ID.
- Automatically selects 3 random validators
- Creates a pending application
- Returns application ID

#### `Vote(cur realm, applicationID uint64, approve bool)`
Vote on an application (validator only). Must be one of the selected validators.
- `approve`: true to approve, false to reject
- Automatically claims bounty if 2/3 validators approve

#### `GetApplication(id uint64) *Application`
Returns application details by ID.

#### `GetApplicationsForBounty(bountyID uint64) []*Application`
Returns all applications for a specific bounty.

#### `GetApplicationsForValidator(validatorAddr address) []*Application`
Returns all applications assigned to a validator for voting.

#### `GetApplicationCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of applications created.

### Validator Management Functions

#### `AddValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Adds a new validator to the system (admin function).

#### `RemoveValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Deactivates a validator (admin function).

#### `IsValidator(addr address) bool`
Checks if an address is an active validator.

#### `GetActiveValidatorCount() int`
Returns the number of active validators.

#### `ListValidators() string`
Returns a formatted list of all validators and their status.

### Rendering Functions

#### `RenderMyVotes(validatorAddr address) string`
Shows pending applications that need votes from the specified validator, with approve/reject buttons.

#### `Render(path string) string`
Main render function for the realm.

### Bounty Structure

```go
type Bounty struct {
    ID          uint64    // Unique bounty identifier
    IssueURL    string    // Link to the issue
    Description string    // Description of the work
    Amount      int64     // Reward amount in ugnot
    Creator     address   // Address of the bounty creator
    CreatedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was created
    IsClaimed   bool      // Whether the bounty has been claimed
    Claimer     address   // Address of the claimer (if claimed)
    ClaimedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was claimed
}
```

## Example Workflow

1. **Alice creates a bounty** for fixing a bug, sending 5 GNOT:
   ```
   CreateBounty("https://github.com/project/repo/issues/42", "Fix memory leak in parser")
   ```

2. **Bob sees the bounty** and decides to work on it. He visits the issue URL and starts coding.

3. **Bob completes the work** and submits a pull request fixing the issue.

4. **Alice verifies the fix** and approves Bob's claim:
   ```
   ClaimBounty(cross, 1, "g1bob123...xyz")
   ```

5. **Bob receives 5 GNOT** automatically to his address!

## Security Considerations

- Only the bounty creator can approve claims
- Bounties are locked in the realm contract until claimed or cancelled
- Once claimed, bounties cannot be cancelled
- The realm must have sufficient funds to pay out bounties

## Notes

- This implementation uses the new Gno standard library split (post-#3874)
- Amounts are stored in ugnot (micro-GNOT): 1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot
- The `address` type is used as a builtin instead of `std.Address`
- Uses new imports:
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain` for `Coin` and `Coins` types
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/banker` for banker operations (`NewBanker`, `BankerType*`, `OriginSend`)
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/runtime` for realm functions (`PreviousRealm`, `CurrentRealm`)

## License

MIT

README.md
files.body:
# GnoBounty

A decentralized bounty system for managing rewards on GitHub issues (or any issue tracker) using the Gno blockchain, with DAO-based validation through validator voting.

## Features

- **Create Bounties**: Post a bounty on any issue by providing the issue URL and sending GNOT tokens
- **Apply for Bounties**: Submit your merged PR link to apply for a bounty
- **DAO Validation**: 3 validators are randomly selected to vote on each application
- **Automatic Claims**: Bounties are automatically claimed when 2/3 validators approve
- **Validator System**: Decentralized validation through registered validators
- **Cancel Bounties**: Creators can cancel unclaimed bounties and receive a refund
- **List Bounties**: Browse all active bounties with reward amounts
- **Transparent**: All bounties and applications are stored on-chain and publicly viewable

## How to Use

### Creating a Bounty

To create a bounty, call the `CreateBounty` function with the issue URL and description, and send GNOT tokens:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "CreateBounty" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/1234" \
  -args "Fix the rendering bug in GRC20 token display" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- `issueURL`: The URL of the issue (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
- `description`: A brief description of what needs to be done
- `send`: The bounty amount in ugnot (1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot)

**Minimum bounty**: 1 GNOT (1,000,000 ugnot)

### Viewing Bounties

Visit the realm in your browser to see all active bounties:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3
```

Or view a specific bounty by ID:

```
https://gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3/1
```

### Applying for a Bounty

When you complete work on a bounty, submit your merged PR link to apply:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "ApplyForBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/5678" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Bounty ID
- Second arg: URL of your merged pull request

**What happens next:**
1. Your application is created
2. 3 random validators are selected from the validator pool
3. Validators review your PR and vote to approve or reject
4. If 2 out of 3 validators approve, the bounty is automatically transferred to you!

### Validator Voting

If you're a registered validator, you can vote on applications assigned to you:

```bash
# Approve an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey

# Reject an application
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "false" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Parameters:**
- First arg: Application ID
- Second arg: "true" to approve, "false" to reject

### Legacy: Manual Claiming (deprecated)

The old manual claim system is still available but deprecated in favor of DAO validation:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "ClaimBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "g1abc123...xyz" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

### Cancelling a Bounty

If you need to cancel a bounty and get your funds back:

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/greg007/gnobounty_v3" \
  -func "CancelBounty" \
  -args "1" \
  -gas-fee "1000000ugnot" \
  -gas-wanted "2000000" \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "dev" \
  -remote "localhost:26657" \
  mykey
```

**Note:** You can only cancel bounties that haven't been claimed yet.

## API Reference

### Bounty Functions

#### `CreateBounty(cur realm, issueURL, description string) uint64`
Creates a new bounty and returns the bounty ID. Must send GNOT with the transaction.

#### `GetBounty(id uint64) *Bounty`
Returns bounty details by ID.

#### `CancelBounty(cur realm, id uint64)`
Cancels a bounty and refunds the creator. Only callable by the bounty creator on unclaimed bounties.

#### `ListBounties() string`
Returns a formatted list of all active bounties.

#### `GetBountyDetails(id uint64) string`
Returns detailed information about a specific bounty with apply button.

#### `GetBountyCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of bounties created.

### Application & Voting Functions

#### `ApplyForBounty(cur realm, bountyID uint64, prLink string) uint64`
Submit an application for a bounty with your merged PR link. Returns the application ID.
- Automatically selects 3 random validators
- Creates a pending application
- Returns application ID

#### `Vote(cur realm, applicationID uint64, approve bool)`
Vote on an application (validator only). Must be one of the selected validators.
- `approve`: true to approve, false to reject
- Automatically claims bounty if 2/3 validators approve

#### `GetApplication(id uint64) *Application`
Returns application details by ID.

#### `GetApplicationsForBounty(bountyID uint64) []*Application`
Returns all applications for a specific bounty.

#### `GetApplicationsForValidator(validatorAddr address) []*Application`
Returns all applications assigned to a validator for voting.

#### `GetApplicationCount() uint64`
Returns the total number of applications created.

### Validator Management Functions

#### `AddValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Adds a new validator to the system (admin function).

#### `RemoveValidator(cur realm, validatorAddr address)`
Deactivates a validator (admin function).

#### `IsValidator(addr address) bool`
Checks if an address is an active validator.

#### `GetActiveValidatorCount() int`
Returns the number of active validators.

#### `ListValidators() string`
Returns a formatted list of all validators and their status.

### Rendering Functions

#### `RenderMyVotes(validatorAddr address) string`
Shows pending applications that need votes from the specified validator, with approve/reject buttons.

#### `Render(path string) string`
Main render function for the realm.

### Bounty Structure

```go
type Bounty struct {
    ID          uint64    // Unique bounty identifier
    IssueURL    string    // Link to the issue
    Description string    // Description of the work
    Amount      int64     // Reward amount in ugnot
    Creator     address   // Address of the bounty creator
    CreatedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was created
    IsClaimed   bool      // Whether the bounty has been claimed
    Claimer     address   // Address of the claimer (if claimed)
    ClaimedAt   time.Time // When the bounty was claimed
}
```

## Example Workflow

1. **Alice creates a bounty** for fixing a bug, sending 5 GNOT:
   ```
   CreateBounty("https://github.com/project/repo/issues/42", "Fix memory leak in parser")
   ```

2. **Bob sees the bounty** and decides to work on it. He visits the issue URL and starts coding.

3. **Bob completes the work** and submits a pull request fixing the issue.

4. **Alice verifies the fix** and approves Bob's claim:
   ```
   ClaimBounty(cross, 1, "g1bob123...xyz")
   ```

5. **Bob receives 5 GNOT** automatically to his address!

## Security Considerations

- Only the bounty creator can approve claims
- Bounties are locked in the realm contract until claimed or cancelled
- Once claimed, bounties cannot be cancelled
- The realm must have sufficient funds to pay out bounties

## Notes

- This implementation uses the new Gno standard library split (post-#3874)
- Amounts are stored in ugnot (micro-GNOT): 1 GNOT = 1,000,000 ugnot
- The `address` type is used as a builtin instead of `std.Address`
- Uses new imports:
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain` for `Coin` and `Coins` types
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/banker` for banker operations (`NewBanker`, `BankerType*`, `OriginSend`)
  - `gno.land/r/sys/chain/runtime` for realm functions (`PreviousRealm`, `CurrentRealm`)

## License

MIT

files.body:
# GnopenSea - NFT Marketplace

Marketplace NFT d√©centralis√© sur Gno.land avec gouvernance DAO.

## üöÄ Comment lister votre NFT en 3 √©tapes

### √âtape 1 : Enregistrer votre collection

**Depuis votre package NFT**, appelez la fonction `Register()` :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

Cela enregistre votre collection dans le **Registry DAO** (statut: non v√©rifi√©).

### √âtape 2 : Approuver le marketplace

Donnez la permission au marketplace de transf√©rer vos NFTs :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-du-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### √âtape 3 : Cr√©er votre listing

Listez votre NFT √† vendre :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CreateListing" \
  -args "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "5000000" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**Param√®tres :**
- 1er arg : Adresse de votre package NFT
- 2√®me arg : Token ID √† vendre
- 3√®me arg : Prix en ugnot (5000000 = 5 GNOT)

---

## üõí Acheter un NFT

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "BuyNFT" \
  -args "1" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìã G√©rer vos listings

### Modifier le prix

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "UpdatePrice" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "10000000" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### Annuler un listing

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CancelListing" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üé® Faire v√©rifier votre collection (badge v√©rifi√©)

### 1. Cr√©er une proposal au Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "ProposeVerifyCollection" \
  -args "g1[adresse-de-votre-nft]" \
  -args "Nom de la collection" \
  -args "Raison de la v√©rification" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Les membres du DAO votent

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "VoteRegistry" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### 3. Ex√©cuter la proposal (apr√®s quorum)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "TallyRegistryProposal" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üí∞ Distribution des paiements

Exemple avec frais marketplace 2.5% et royalties 10% :

```
Prix de vente : 100 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frais marketplace (2.5%) : 2.5 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Royalties cr√©ateur (10%) : 10 GNOT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendeur re√ßoit : 87.5 GNOT
```

---

## üèõÔ∏è Gouvernance DAO

Le marketplace est gouvern√© par un DAO. Les membres peuvent cr√©er des proposals pour :

- ‚úÖ Approuver/retirer des collections
- ‚úÖ Modifier les frais du marketplace
- ‚úÖ Retirer des fonds du tr√©sor
- ‚úÖ Annuler un listing probl√©matique

### Cr√©er une proposal (exemple: modifier les frais)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "ProposeUpdateFees" \
  -args "300" \
  -args "R√©duction des frais √† 3%" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### Voter sur une proposal

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

---

## üîß Configuration NFT minimale

Votre package NFT doit avoir une fonction `Register()` :

```go
package mynft

import (
    "gno.land/p/demo/tokens/grc721"
    "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4"
)

var (
    nft         *grc721.basicNFT
    myRealmAddr = runtime.CurrentRealm().Address()
)

func init() {
    nft = grc721.NewBasicNFT("My Collection", "MC")
}

// Register dans le registry
func Register(_ realm) {
    daoregistry4.RegisterCollection(
        myRealmAddr,
        "My Collection",
        "MC",
        "art",
        "Description de ma collection",
        "https://mon-site.com",
        false,
        nft.Getter(),
    )
}

// Fonction obligatoire pour le marketplace
func Getter() grc721.NFTGetter {
    return nft.Getter()
}
```

---

## üìä Fonctions de lecture

```bash
# Voir tous les listings actifs
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:

# Statistiques du marketplace
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:stats

# D√©tails d'un listing
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:listing/1

# Collections enregistr√©es
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4:
```

---

## üîê S√©curit√©

- ‚úÖ V√©rification de propri√©t√© avant listing
- ‚úÖ V√©rification d'approbation avant vente
- ‚úÖ Transferts atomiques
- ‚úÖ Remboursement automatique des surplus
- ‚úÖ Limites de frais (max 10%)
- ‚úÖ Gouvernance d√©centralis√©e

---

## üÜò Probl√®mes courants

**"Collection not registered"**
‚Üí Vous devez d'abord appeler `Register()` sur votre NFT

**"Insufficient payment"**
‚Üí Le montant envoy√© doit correspondre au prix du listing

**"Not approved"**
‚Üí Appelez `SetApprovalForAll()` avant de cr√©er un listing

**"Not owner"**
‚Üí Seul le propri√©taire du NFT peut le lister

```
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Royalties cr√©ateur (10%) : 10 GNOT

```

## üèõÔ∏è Gouvernance DAO

Le marketplace est gouvern√© par un DAO. Les membres peuvent cr√©er des proposals pour :

- ‚úÖ Approuver/retirer des collections
- ‚úÖ Modifier les frais du marketplace
- ‚úÖ Retirer des fonds du tr√©sor

files.name: voting.gno
README.md
files.body:
# My NFT Collection - NFT avec Image Fixe

Package NFT avec **image fixe** d√©finie dans le code : tous les NFTs de cette collection partagent la m√™me image.

## ‚ú® Fonctionnalit√©s

- ‚úÖ Support de m√©tadonn√©es onchain (GRC721Metadata)
- ‚úÖ **Image fixe** d√©finie dans le code (tous les NFTs ont la m√™me apparence)
- ‚úÖ Nom et description personnalis√©s par NFT
- ‚úÖ Attributs/traits personnalis√©s (optionnel)
- ‚úÖ Compatible avec GnopenSea marketplace

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration de l'Image

**AVANT de d√©ployer**, change l'URL de l'image dans [nft.gno](nft.gno#L18) :

```go
var (
    // ...
    // CHANGE TON URL ICI ‚Üì
    collectionImageURL = "https://i.imgur.com/VOTRE_IMAGE.jpg"
)
```

### Comment obtenir une URL d'image :

1. **Imgur** (recommand√© pour tester) :
   - Va sur [imgur.com](https://imgur.com)
   - Upload ton image
   - Clique droit ‚Üí "Copy image address"
   - Colle l'URL dans `collectionImageURL`

2. **IPFS** (d√©centralis√©) :
   - Upload via [Pinata](https://pinata.cloud) ou [NFT.Storage](https://nft.storage)
   - Utilise : `https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmVotreCID/image.png`

---

## üöÄ D√©ploiement

```bash
gnokey maketx addpkg \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -pkgdir "./community/packages/r/pierre115/my_nft_collection" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 100000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìù Utilisation

### 1. Enregistrer la collection dans le Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Mint un NFT

#### **Option A : NFT Simple (nom + description)**

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "MintNFT" \
  -args "Cosmic Cat #1" \
  -args "A mystical cat floating in space" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

**R√©sultat** : NFT avec :
- Image : celle d√©finie dans `collectionImageURL`
- Nom : "Cosmic Cat #1"
- Description : "A mystical cat floating in space"

#### **Option B : NFT avec Attributs** (ex: jeu, collection rare)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "MintNFTWithAttributes" \
  -args "Epic Sword #42" \
  -args "Legendary weapon forged in dragon fire" \
  -args '["Rarity","Power","Element"]' \
  -args '["Legendary","95","Fire"]' \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**R√©sultat** : NFT avec :
- Image : celle d√©finie dans `collectionImageURL`
- Nom : "Epic Sword #42"
- Attributs :
  - **Rarity**: Legendary
  - **Power**: 95
  - **Element**: Fire

### 3. Voir les m√©tadonn√©es d'un NFT

```bash
# Via render
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection:1

# Via fonction
gnokey query vm/qeval \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  -data "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection
GetTokenMetadata(\"1\")"
```

### 4. Approuver le marketplace

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìä Structure de M√©tadonn√©es

Tous les NFTs ont la structure suivante :

```go
Metadata {
    Name:        "Nom personnalis√© par mint",
    Description: "Description personnalis√©e par mint",
    Image:       "https://i.imgur.com/VOTRE_IMAGE.jpg", // ‚Üê FIXE pour tous
    Attributes:  [
        { TraitType: "Rarity",  Value: "Legendary" }, // Optionnel
        { TraitType: "Power",   Value: "95" },
        // ...
    ]
}
```

**Important** : L'image est identique pour tous les NFTs, seuls le nom, la description et les attributs changent.

---

## üîç Fonctions Disponibles

| Fonction | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Register()` | Enregistrer la collection dans le registry |
| `MintNFT(name, desc)` | Mint NFT simple (pas besoin de passer l'URL d'image) |
| `MintNFTWithAttributes(name, desc, traits, values)` | Mint NFT avec attributs personnalis√©s |
| `GetTokenMetadata(tokenId)` | Voir les m√©tadonn√©es d'un NFT |
| `SetApprovalForAll(operator, approved)` | Approuver un op√©rateur |
| `Getter()` | Obtenir le NFTGetter (pour marketplace) |
| `GetCollectionInfo()` | Informations sur la collection |

---

## üéØ Cas d'Usage

### Collection de Tickets / Memberships

Tous les membres ont le m√™me badge visuel :

```bash
# Tous auront la m√™me image (logo du club)
MintNFT("Member #1", "Gold Member")
MintNFT("Member #2", "Silver Member")
MintNFT("Member #3", "Gold Member")
```

### Collection de Jeu avec Stats Variables

M√™me apparence mais stats diff√©rentes :

```bash
MintNFTWithAttributes(
  "Warrior #1",
  "Strong warrior",
  ["Attack", "Defense", "Speed"],
  ["100", "50", "75"]
)

MintNFTWithAttributes(
  "Warrior #2",
  "Fast warrior",
  ["Attack", "Defense", "Speed"],
  ["80", "40", "95"]
)
```

Tous les Warriors ont la m√™me image, mais des stats diff√©rentes !

---

## üîó Int√©gration avec GnopenSea

Une fois d√©ploy√© et enregistr√© :
1. Tous les NFTs de cette collection afficheront **la m√™me image** sur le marketplace
2. Les noms et descriptions seront affich√©s dans la carte NFT
3. Les attributs seront visibles sur la page de d√©tail

---

## üí° Pourquoi une Image Fixe ?

‚úÖ **Avantages** :
- Plus simple √† mint (pas besoin de passer l'URL √† chaque fois)
- Parfait pour les collections de "tickets" ou "memberships"
- Id√©al pour les jeux o√π l'apparence est fixe mais les stats varient
- Moins cher en gas (pas besoin de stocker l'URL √† chaque mint)

‚ùå **D√©savantage** :
- Tous les NFTs ont la m√™me apparence visuelle
- Pas adapt√© pour collections d'art avec pi√®ces uniques

**Pour des images diff√©rentes par NFT**, utilise plut√¥t le package `my_test_nft` avec imageURL en param√®tre.

---

## üìÑ License

Projet de stage - Tous droits r√©serv√©s

README.md
files.body:
# GnopenSea - NFT Marketplace

Marketplace NFT d√©centralis√© sur Gno.land avec gouvernance DAO.

## üöÄ Comment lister votre NFT en 3 √©tapes

### √âtape 1 : Enregistrer votre collection

**Depuis votre package NFT**, appelez la fonction `Register()` :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

Cela enregistre votre collection dans le **Registry DAO** (statut: non v√©rifi√©).

### √âtape 2 : Approuver le marketplace

Donnez la permission au marketplace de transf√©rer vos NFTs :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-du-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### √âtape 3 : Cr√©er votre listing

Listez votre NFT √† vendre :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CreateListing" \
  -args "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "5000000" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**Param√®tres :**
- 1er arg : Adresse de votre package NFT
- 2√®me arg : Token ID √† vendre
- 3√®me arg : Prix en ugnot (5000000 = 5 GNOT)

---

## üõí Acheter un NFT

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "BuyNFT" \
  -args "1" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìã G√©rer vos listings

### Modifier le prix

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "UpdatePrice" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "10000000" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### Annuler un listing

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CancelListing" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üé® Faire v√©rifier votre collection (badge v√©rifi√©)

### 1. Cr√©er une proposal au Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "ProposeVerifyCollection" \
  -args "g1[adresse-de-votre-nft]" \
  -args "Nom de la collection" \
  -args "Raison de la v√©rification" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Les membres du DAO votent

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "VoteRegistry" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### 3. Ex√©cuter la proposal (apr√®s quorum)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "TallyRegistryProposal" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üí∞ Distribution des paiements

Exemple avec frais marketplace 2.5% et royalties 10% :

```
Prix de vente : 100 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frais marketplace (2.5%) : 2.5 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Royalties cr√©ateur (10%) : 10 GNOT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendeur re√ßoit : 87.5 GNOT
```

---

## üèõÔ∏è Gouvernance DAO

Le marketplace est gouvern√© par un DAO. Les membres peuvent cr√©er des proposals pour :

- ‚úÖ Approuver/retirer des collections
- ‚úÖ Modifier les frais du marketplace
- ‚úÖ Retirer des fonds du tr√©sor
- ‚úÖ Annuler un listing probl√©matique

### Cr√©er une proposal (exemple: modifier les frais)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "ProposeUpdateFees" \
  -args "300" \
  -args "R√©duction des frais √† 3%" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### Voter sur une proposal

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

---

## üîß Configuration NFT minimale

Votre package NFT doit avoir une fonction `Register()` :

```go
package mynft

import (
    "gno.land/p/demo/tokens/grc721"
    "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4"
)

var (
    nft         *grc721.basicNFT
    myRealmAddr = runtime.CurrentRealm().Address()
)

func init() {
    nft = grc721.NewBasicNFT("My Collection", "MC")
}

// Register dans le registry
func Register(_ realm) {
    daoregistry4.RegisterCollection(
        myRealmAddr,
        "My Collection",
        "MC",
        "art",
        "Description de ma collection",
        "https://mon-site.com",
        false,
        nft.Getter(),
    )
}

// Fonction obligatoire pour le marketplace
func Getter() grc721.NFTGetter {
    return nft.Getter()
}
```

---

## üìä Fonctions de lecture

```bash
# Voir tous les listings actifs
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:

# Statistiques du marketplace
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:stats

# D√©tails d'un listing
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:listing/1

# Collections enregistr√©es
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4:
```

---

## üîê S√©curit√©

- ‚úÖ V√©rification de propri√©t√© avant listing
- ‚úÖ V√©rification d'approbation avant vente
- ‚úÖ Transferts atomiques
- ‚úÖ Remboursement automatique des surplus
- ‚úÖ Limites de frais (max 10%)
- ‚úÖ Gouvernance d√©centralis√©e

---

## üÜò Probl√®mes courants

**"Collection not registered"**
‚Üí Vous devez d'abord appeler `Register()` sur votre NFT

**"Insufficient payment"**
‚Üí Le montant envoy√© doit correspondre au prix du listing

files.name: voting.gno
README.md
files.body:
# My NFT Collection - NFT avec Image Fixe

Package NFT avec **image fixe** d√©finie dans le code : tous les NFTs de cette collection partagent la m√™me image.

## ‚ú® Fonctionnalit√©s

- ‚úÖ Support de m√©tadonn√©es onchain (GRC721Metadata)
- ‚úÖ **Image fixe** d√©finie dans le code (tous les NFTs ont la m√™me apparence)
- ‚úÖ Nom et description personnalis√©s par NFT
- ‚úÖ Attributs/traits personnalis√©s (optionnel)
- ‚úÖ Compatible avec GnopenSea marketplace

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration de l'Image

**AVANT de d√©ployer**, change l'URL de l'image dans [nft.gno](nft.gno#L18) :

```go
var (
    // ...
    // CHANGE TON URL ICI ‚Üì
    collectionImageURL = "https://i.imgur.com/VOTRE_IMAGE.jpg"
)
```

### Comment obtenir une URL d'image :

1. **Imgur** (recommand√© pour tester) :
   - Va sur [imgur.com](https://imgur.com)
   - Upload ton image
   - Clique droit ‚Üí "Copy image address"
   - Colle l'URL dans `collectionImageURL`

2. **IPFS** (d√©centralis√©) :
   - Upload via [Pinata](https://pinata.cloud) ou [NFT.Storage](https://nft.storage)
   - Utilise : `https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmVotreCID/image.png`

---

## üöÄ D√©ploiement

```bash
gnokey maketx addpkg \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -pkgdir "./community/packages/r/pierre115/my_nft_collection" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 100000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìù Utilisation

### 1. Enregistrer la collection dans le Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Mint un NFT

#### **Option A : NFT Simple (nom + description)**

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "MintNFT" \
  -args "Cosmic Cat #1" \
  -args "A mystical cat floating in space" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

**R√©sultat** : NFT avec :
- Image : celle d√©finie dans `collectionImageURL`
- Nom : "Cosmic Cat #1"
- Description : "A mystical cat floating in space"

#### **Option B : NFT avec Attributs** (ex: jeu, collection rare)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "MintNFTWithAttributes" \
  -args "Epic Sword #42" \
  -args "Legendary weapon forged in dragon fire" \
  -args '["Rarity","Power","Element"]' \
  -args '["Legendary","95","Fire"]' \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**R√©sultat** : NFT avec :
- Image : celle d√©finie dans `collectionImageURL`
- Nom : "Epic Sword #42"
- Attributs :
  - **Rarity**: Legendary
  - **Power**: 95
  - **Element**: Fire

### 3. Voir les m√©tadonn√©es d'un NFT

```bash
# Via render
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection:1

# Via fonction
gnokey query vm/qeval \
  -remote "https://rpc.gno.land:443" \
  -data "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection
GetTokenMetadata(\"1\")"
```

### 4. Approuver le marketplace

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/mynftcollection" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìä Structure de M√©tadonn√©es

Tous les NFTs ont la structure suivante :

```go
Metadata {
    Name:        "Nom personnalis√© par mint",
    Description: "Description personnalis√©e par mint",
    Image:       "https://i.imgur.com/VOTRE_IMAGE.jpg", // ‚Üê FIXE pour tous
    Attributes:  [
        { TraitType: "Rarity",  Value: "Legendary" }, // Optionnel
        { TraitType: "Power",   Value: "95" },
        // ...
    ]
}
```

**Important** : L'image est identique pour tous les NFTs, seuls le nom, la description et les attributs changent.

---

## üîç Fonctions Disponibles

| Fonction | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `Register()` | Enregistrer la collection dans le registry |
| `MintNFT(name, desc)` | Mint NFT simple (pas besoin de passer l'URL d'image) |
| `MintNFTWithAttributes(name, desc, traits, values)` | Mint NFT avec attributs personnalis√©s |
| `GetTokenMetadata(tokenId)` | Voir les m√©tadonn√©es d'un NFT |
| `SetApprovalForAll(operator, approved)` | Approuver un op√©rateur |
| `Getter()` | Obtenir le NFTGetter (pour marketplace) |
| `GetCollectionInfo()` | Informations sur la collection |

---

## üéØ Cas d'Usage

### Collection de Tickets / Memberships

Tous les membres ont le m√™me badge visuel :

```bash
# Tous auront la m√™me image (logo du club)
MintNFT("Member #1", "Gold Member")
MintNFT("Member #2", "Silver Member")
MintNFT("Member #3", "Gold Member")
```

### Collection de Jeu avec Stats Variables

M√™me apparence mais stats diff√©rentes :

```bash
MintNFTWithAttributes(
  "Warrior #1",
  "Strong warrior",
  ["Attack", "Defense", "Speed"],
  ["100", "50", "75"]
)

MintNFTWithAttributes(
  "Warrior #2",
  "Fast warrior",
  ["Attack", "Defense", "Speed"],
  ["80", "40", "95"]
)
```

Tous les Warriors ont la m√™me image, mais des stats diff√©rentes !

---

## üîó Int√©gration avec GnopenSea

Une fois d√©ploy√© et enregistr√© :
1. Tous les NFTs de cette collection afficheront **la m√™me image** sur le marketplace
2. Les noms et descriptions seront affich√©s dans la carte NFT
3. Les attributs seront visibles sur la page de d√©tail

---

## üí° Pourquoi une Image Fixe ?

‚úÖ **Avantages** :
- Plus simple √† mint (pas besoin de passer l'URL √† chaque fois)
- Parfait pour les collections de "tickets" ou "memberships"
- Id√©al pour les jeux o√π l'apparence est fixe mais les stats varient
- Moins cher en gas (pas besoin de stocker l'URL √† chaque mint)

‚ùå **D√©savantage** :
- Tous les NFTs ont la m√™me apparence visuelle
- Pas adapt√© pour collections d'art avec pi√®ces uniques

**Pour des images diff√©rentes par NFT**, utilise plut√¥t le package `my_test_nft` avec imageURL en param√®tre.

---

## üìÑ License

Projet de stage - Tous droits r√©serv√©s

files.name: nft.gno
README.md
files.body:
# GnopenSea - NFT Marketplace

Marketplace NFT d√©centralis√© sur Gno.land avec gouvernance DAO.

## üöÄ Comment lister votre NFT en 3 √©tapes

### √âtape 1 : Enregistrer votre collection

**Depuis votre package NFT**, appelez la fonction `Register()` :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "Register" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  -chainid "staging" \
  votre-wallet
```

Cela enregistre votre collection dans le **Registry DAO** (statut: non v√©rifi√©).

### √âtape 2 : Approuver le marketplace

Donnez la permission au marketplace de transf√©rer vos NFTs :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -func "SetApprovalForAll" \
  -args "g1[adresse-du-marketplace]" \
  -args "true" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### √âtape 3 : Cr√©er votre listing

Listez votre NFT √† vendre :

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CreateListing" \
  -args "gno.land/r/[votre-username]/[votre-nft]" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "5000000" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

**Param√®tres :**
- 1er arg : Adresse de votre package NFT
- 2√®me arg : Token ID √† vendre
- 3√®me arg : Prix en ugnot (5000000 = 5 GNOT)

---

## üõí Acheter un NFT

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "BuyNFT" \
  -args "1" \
  -send "5000000ugnot" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üìã G√©rer vos listings

### Modifier le prix

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "UpdatePrice" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "10000000" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### Annuler un listing

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "CancelListing" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üé® Faire v√©rifier votre collection (badge v√©rifi√©)

### 1. Cr√©er une proposal au Registry DAO

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "ProposeVerifyCollection" \
  -args "g1[adresse-de-votre-nft]" \
  -args "Nom de la collection" \
  -args "Raison de la v√©rification" \
  -gas-fee 1000000ugnot \
  -gas-wanted 5000000 \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

### 2. Les membres du DAO votent

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "VoteRegistry" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### 3. Ex√©cuter la proposal (apr√®s quorum)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4" \
  -func "TallyRegistryProposal" \
  -args "1" \
  -broadcast \
  votre-wallet
```

---

## üí∞ Distribution des paiements

Exemple avec frais marketplace 2.5% et royalties 10% :

```
Prix de vente : 100 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Frais marketplace (2.5%) : 2.5 GNOT
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Royalties cr√©ateur (10%) : 10 GNOT
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Vendeur re√ßoit : 87.5 GNOT
```

---

## üèõÔ∏è Gouvernance DAO

Le marketplace est gouvern√© par un DAO. Les membres peuvent cr√©er des proposals pour :

- ‚úÖ Approuver/retirer des collections
- ‚úÖ Modifier les frais du marketplace
- ‚úÖ Retirer des fonds du tr√©sor
- ‚úÖ Annuler un listing probl√©matique

### Cr√©er une proposal (exemple: modifier les frais)

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "ProposeUpdateFees" \
  -args "300" \
  -args "R√©duction des frais √† 3%" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

### Voter sur une proposal

```bash
gnokey maketx call \
  -pkgpath "gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao" \
  -func "Vote" \
  -args "1" \
  -args "yes" \
  -broadcast \
  membre-dao-wallet
```

---

## üîß Configuration NFT minimale

Votre package NFT doit avoir une fonction `Register()` :

```go
package mynft

import (
    "gno.land/p/demo/tokens/grc721"
    "gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4"
)

var (
    nft         *grc721.basicNFT
    myRealmAddr = runtime.CurrentRealm().Address()
)

func init() {
    nft = grc721.NewBasicNFT("My Collection", "MC")
}

// Register dans le registry
func Register(_ realm) {
    daoregistry4.RegisterCollection(
        myRealmAddr,
        "My Collection",
        "MC",
        "art",
        "Description de ma collection",
        "https://mon-site.com",
        false,
        nft.Getter(),
    )
}

// Fonction obligatoire pour le marketplace
func Getter() grc721.NFTGetter {
    return nft.Getter()
}
```

---

## üìä Fonctions de lecture

```bash
# Voir tous les listings actifs
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:

# Statistiques du marketplace
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:stats

# D√©tails d'un listing
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/gnopendao:listing/1

# Collections enregistr√©es
curl https://rpc.gno.land/r/pierre115/daoregistry4:
```

---

## üîê S√©curit√©

- ‚úÖ V√©rification de propri√©t√© avant listing
- ‚úÖ V√©rification d'approbation avant vente
- ‚úÖ Transferts atomiques
- ‚úÖ Remboursement automatique des surplus
- ‚úÖ Limites de frais (max 10%)
- ‚úÖ Gouvernance d√©centralis√©e

---

## üÜò Probl√®mes courants

**"Collection not registered"**
‚Üí Vous devez d'abord appeler `Register()` sur votre NFT

**"Insufficient payment"**
‚Üí Le montant envoy√© doit correspondre au prix du listing

**"Not approved"**
‚Üí Appelez `SetApprovalForAll()` avant de cr√©er un listing

**"Not owner"**
‚Üí Seul le propri√©taire du NFT peut le lister

type Language string

const (
	French    Language = "french"
	Italian   Language = "italian"
	Spanish   Language = "spanish"
	Hindi     Language = "hindi"
	Bulgarian Language = "bulgarian"
	Serbian   Language = "serbian"
)

// GetGreeting generates a greeting in
// the specified language
func GetGreeting(language Language) string {
	switch language {
	case French:
		return "Bonjour"
	case Italian:
		return "Ciao"
	case Spanish:
		return "Hola"
	case Hindi:
		return "‡§®‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á"
	case Bulgarian:
		return "–ó–¥—Ä–∞–≤–µ–π—Ç–µ"
	case Serbian:
		return "–ó–¥—Ä–∞–≤–æ"
	default:
		return "Hello"
	}
}
